Residents in #Calderdale can read the latest on our progress on #flood defences in #Mytholmroyd in the spring edition of Valley Life magazine @ValleyLifeMg #FCERM 
https://t.co/UMpGaEKVpM https://t.co/p8KCQyaMQk

Sadly, @Feargal_Sharkey makes a good point.  More incompetence from @DefraGovUK and the same old problem of them - and their paid acolytes @EnvAgency -  being woeful at enforcing existing environmental laws. https://t.co/7L4cUVJbOh

When poisonous fumes invade my house my throat is sore&I need to use my asthma inhalers.They often come at night.I can‚Äôt sleep with the fear&anxiety of what it‚Äôs doing to my young son.When will you act?@EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Massive areas of Newcastle and Stoke kept awake by the horrid stink coming from the landfill again last night. @RedIndustries2 How can you fix the problem if you don't acknowledge is coming from you?!!!! #capitoff

@EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC it's nights like last night that we need people on the ground investigating the smell from #WalleysQuarry, it seems to have been intense and to have spread far and wide across the borough. 4 hours broken sleep. #stopthestink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL

Just so any returning birders don‚Äôt have heart attacks. Here‚Äôs the extent of the habitat loss so far. Don‚Äôt go expecting Whitethroats and flycatchers this year. üòî New Passage. Brought to you by the anti - @EnvAgency https://t.co/DxyEe0K3tN

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids one week with no stench, no inhaler and no pregnancy problems. Tonight is as bad as it was end of Feb and I‚Äôm lying here on my spacer and having the same pains I did when I was rushed to hospital just over a week ago. @StinkStopthe #stopthestink

Newcastle under Lyme residents calling the @EnvAgency between 2&4:30am last night as the smell was so bad they couldn‚Äôt sleep! This is an atrocious quality of life & how are they expected to work today? Time for change @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe

M6 J12 to J13 a eagle eyed @HighwaysWMIDS who was monitoring the CCTV cameras notice the occupants of a Passat dumping rubbish in a ERA bay.  We intercepted the vehicle M6 J14 to J15 and escorted them back clear their rubbish up.  Details passed to @EnvAgency. 5419 https://t.co/5tWwYYiaDZ

tweets.text:
Dear old @Defra rather hilariously trying to pretend that dumping sewage into our rivers hasn't actually been illegal for the last 20 years. 

Here's a hint. Trying enforcing existing legislation your time might be better spent. https://t.co/kCgTOk4rwC

We're working with @bradfordmdc, using nature based solutions to reduce #flood risk as well as providing habitats for wildlife and green space for communities, helping to improve air and water quality and helping Yorkshire become more resilient to #ClimateChange @YHClimateCom https://t.co/RPdoXjClIc

We‚Äôre working hard to tackle #WasteCrime. 

We‚Äôve developed a new tool that makes it easier for you to know if your waste carrier is registered with us. 

Find out more here: https://t.co/l4EG6rV1DW

üè≠üò∑This week, I raised my concerns about plans approved for #AireValleyIncinerator which were given green light by Labour run @bradfordmdc & @EnvAgency ‚ùå

You can WATCH highlightsüëá& my full 20 min speech by visiting https://t.co/GShCkqEC2t

#Keighley #Ilkley @AireIncinerator https://t.co/1U0JOmrUF6

urls.title: Incinerator debated in Parliament
urls.description: Keighley and Ilkley MP Robbie Moore secured an adjournment debate in the House of Commons to criticise the decision made by the Environment Agency and Bradford Council over the Aire Valley Incinerator

tweets.text:
It's vitally important we protect our rivers.
That's why we're creating new legal duties on water companies and government to reduce the amount of sewage discharged into our waterways.
Find out more: https://t.co/ofgpkeZ0eN https://t.co/RoiNLfCUMI

We‚Äôre looking forward to working closely with our partners to develop 25 innovative projects to respond to flooding across England.

The Flood and Coastal Resilience Innovation Programme will inform our approach to the climate crisis in the run-up to #COP26 and beyond. https://t.co/uLncFImWcY

Suns shining today while we install a @BiomatrixWater floating ecosystem into #royalquaysmarina can‚Äôt wait to collaborate with @NCLDoveMarine to quantify the biodiversity gains from this innovative system #teamea @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @GWKNE https://t.co/LnJnIsg99M

@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency This is scary for people that live close to landfill, how is this going on a our country NATIONAL DISGRACE!!! #stopthestink #capitoff https://t.co/jtAUsEtO0x

@DHSCgovuk Our town is struggling to meet family in their gardens due to poisonous hydrogen sulphide https://t.co/UxkUojn8kb will our town will be able to stick to the rules if this reckless endangerment of the residents health continues ?@BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe

Local people feel like their homes are a ‚Äúprison‚Äù due to landfill fumes.Incredibly sad after the first warm spring day yesterday when ‚Äòoutdoor‚Äô meet ups are mandatory @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice what are you going to do about it? U cannot stay silent! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe

tweets.text:
@LianaJane @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe I‚Äôm poolfields, spent the first 14 weeks in EPU with bleeding that only ever came the day after the stench. No problems whatsoever when the smell isn‚Äôt there!
Have you reported it to your doctor??

@KatieMuchan @CumbriaRain @EnvAgencyNW @metoffice @metofficeNWEng Gosh, those were tricky to process, Katie! Very difficult to get coordinates of suitable scaling points... So, to demonstrate that the software can detect the movement, but that we can't trust the scaling, I've removed velocity labels..... https://t.co/KGkpd5sVVR

Thank you @EnvAgency National Monitoring team for the virtual visit:

Your hard work restoring habitats and innovative live data monitoring helps tackle the #ClimateEmergency 

Proud of #TeamEA's #Covid19 waste water testing helping support the national effort against the virus. https://t.co/gy6waMYIX2

tweets.text:
We‚Äôve delivered our largest ever programme of #flood and coastal defence improvements!

Working with partners, we‚Äôve helped protect over 300,000 homes from flooding and supported communities to become more resilient to #ClimateChange

Read more: https://t.co/5Bgax4pg9n

#FCERM https://t.co/mS2pKBFb18

My local riverbank, usually beautiful. No one will clear up the mess except local volunteers. Plastic on every tree and sanitary pads embedded in the river bank. @thameswater @EnvAgencySE stop untreated sewage release! @HMUG_Hackney @julian_kirby https://t.co/OEnq7AAmS4

Our fisheries enforcement officers joined in a multi-agency patrol in #Burton-upon-Trent to curb out-of-season fishing & anti-social behaviour. Two anglers reported for offences. Info on closed season here https://t.co/9Tvv7Ua5cc @eaststaffsbc @StaffsPolice @AnglingTrust https://t.co/YA3Jg1gWOX

urls.title: Close season for coarse fishing gets underway for 2021
urls.description: The Environment Agency is reminding anglers the ‚Äòclose season‚Äô for coarse fish in rivers comes into effect from Monday 15 March and runs until 15 June.

3 of the 25 projects that have secured a share of ¬£150m funding to test new approaches to #flood risk management are in the #NorthWest! 

They include proactive property flood resilience, natural flood management & enhancing the resilience of our coasts

urls.title: Launching the flood and coastal resilience innovation programme
urls.description: Today, 25 pioneering projects have received a share of ¬£150 million of funding to put new aspects of the National Strategy for Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management to the test. ¬†
